result.execSummary:
The defendant Lia M Bassindale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, and assessments by 12-01-16; any balance remaining to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant to serve the first 5 days STRAIGHT TIME. If there are no major rule violations the balance of the time to be served with release to the Day Reporting Center. Court has no objection to Electronic monitoring while attending the Day Reporting Center. Any alcohol use, illegal substances use, or rules violations forfeits release privileges and sentence to be served as STRAIGHT TIME

Court advises the defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets conditions under the statue and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lia M Bassindale

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lia M Bassindale in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Parties prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Statements made by the state, defense, and defendant.

COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets conditions under the statute and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  

The Court orders the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with 119 days credit.  Defendant to serve the first 5 days STRAIGHT TIME.  If there are no major rule violations the balance of the time to be served with release to the Day Reporting Center.  The Court has no objection to Electronic Monitoring while attending the Day Reporting Center.  Any alcohol use, illegal substances use, or rules violations forfeits release privileges and sentence to be served as straight time.  The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, and assessments by 12-01-16; any balance remaining to covert to civil judgment.  Appeal right given.  
Filed:
- Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Lia M Bassindale not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/10/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Lia M Bassindale not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lia M Bassindale in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lia M Bassindale in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lia M Bassindale in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Lia M Bassindale in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
